intro: Pimpinella pimpinelloideum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Pimpinella pimpinelloideum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
